 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 2.2 - ENOUGH TIME
NO TIMING(LEVEL AAA)
On accessible websites...

Timing is not an essential part of the event or activity presented by the
content, except for non-interactive synchronized media and real-time events. 

These websites...

Provide users enough time to read and use content.

WHAT'S AN EXAMPLE?
 A game is designed so that users take turns rather than competing in real-time 

One party can pause the game without invalidating the competitive aspect of it.

I still don't really understand
[https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/no-timing.html#examples] Web
Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.2, W3C World Wide Web Consortium
Recommendation 27 February 2020 (https://www.w3.org/TR/2020/WD-WCAG22-20200227/,
Latest version at https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG22/)
